channel.title: Need help with Compiler[317][SOLVED]
channel.description:
hey :) My compiler doesn't work I have all the path's and stuff set correctly but i get the "system can not find the specified path" when i try to compile. My compile.bat in my client look's like this Code: [Select] @echo off title Compile cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\Bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause then when i try to compile it with this code, it says "system can not find the specified path"
the i tryed to change the compile.bat to Code: [Select] @echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit i get javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Finished! when i try to compile it. it wont compile. plz help :) :) :) :)

item.title: Need help with Compiler[317][SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @iamapker iamapker
item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

ok well go to my computer, then click add or remove programs then scroll to the J’s and look for java development kit and look what version it is, then go into your compiler and change the jdk1.6.0_21 to whatever your version is, if you are confused please pm me and i will help you fix this problem cuz you may be having 64 bit issues

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with Compiler[317][SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

Atk2-99:

If you dont know how to find what Java your running off of tell me and ill explain.

C:\Program Files\Java
Look where this paths lead to, does this folder contains jdk1.6.0_21?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with Compiler[317][SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Atk2-99 Atk2-99
item.description:
@Atk2-99 wrote:

This is the most common compiler error. Ill try to help you fix it.

First you need to find what Java your running off of.

@echo off title Compile cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\Bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause

This is your compiler ^^ what you need to change is this

jdk1.6.0_21

Change the 21 to whatever version of Java your using. If you dont know how to find what Java your running off of tell me and ill explain.

Read full topic

if u got a 317 source try this

@echo off title compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

maybe u need to change the 16

item.title: Need help with Compiler[317][SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @zattion zattion
item.description:
@zattion wrote:

hey
My compiler doesn’t work
I have all the path’s and stuff set correctly but i get the “system can not find the specified path” when i try to compile. My compile.bat in my client look’s like this
Code: [Select]
@echo off
title Compile
cd Source
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\Bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java
pause
then when i try to compile it with this code, it says “system can not find the specified path”

the i tryed to change the compile.bat to
Code: [Select]
@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit i get javac: file not found: *.java
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Finished! when i try to compile it. it wont compile.
plz help

Read full topic
